verses.text: 治好癱子耶穌上了船，過到自己的城來。

words.note: Verb + resultative complement
Used as a directional complement
Reflexive pronoun
Used as a directional complement

verses.text: 有人把一個躺在床上的癱子帶到他那裡。耶穌看見他們的信心，就對癱子說：「孩子，放心！你的罪赦了。」

words.note: Used to indicate location 'on'
Used as a complement to indicate arrival
Verb + resultative complement
Lit. 'trusting heart'

words.definition: to set one's mind at rest
words.note: Lit. 'release heart'; meaning 'don't worry'

verses.text: 有幾位經學家彼此說：「這個人在說僭妄的話。」

words.note: Reciprocal pronoun
Can also mean 'blasphemy' (n)

verses.text: 耶穌看出他們所想的，就說：「你們心裡為甚麼存著惡念呢？

words.note: Used as a complement: 看出 (to discern)
Forms a noun phrase from a verb: 所想 (what was thought)
Lit. 'for what reason'

verses.text: 說『你的罪赦了』，或說『起來行走』，哪一樣容易呢？

words.note: Verb + directional complement
Often used formally or in context of physical ability
Used here to mean 'which one'

verses.text: 然而為了要使你們知道人子在地上有赦罪的權柄，（他就對癱子說：）起來，拿起你的床，回家去吧。」

words.note: A title used by Jesus to refer to himself.
Often refers to divine or delegated authority.
Indicates suggestion or command.

verses.text: 他就起來回家去了。

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 群眾看見，就起了敬畏的心，頌讚那把這樣的權柄賜給人的 神。

words.note: A respectful fear or awe, often towards the divine.
Refers to the God who bestowed authority.
Elevated character in Christian contexts to refer to God.

verses.text: 呼召馬太耶穌從那裡往前走，看見一個人，名叫馬太，坐在稅關那裡，就對他說：「來跟從我！」他就起來跟從了耶穌。
耶穌在屋裡吃飯的時候，有很多稅吏和罪人來與他和門徒一起吃飯。
法利賽人看見了，就對他的門徒說：「你們的老師為甚麼跟稅吏和罪人一起吃飯呢？」

words.note: Lit. 'gate follower'.

verses.text: 耶穌聽見了，就說：「健康的人不需要醫生，有病的人才需要，
『我喜愛憐憫，不喜愛祭祀』，你們去想一想這話的意思吧。我來不是要召義人，而是要召罪人。」

words.note: Often refers to God's compassionate nature or act of showing mercy.
Reduplication of verb suggests a brief or relaxed action.

verses.text: 新舊的比喻那時，約翰的門徒前來問耶穌：「為甚麼我們和法利賽人常常禁食，你的門徒卻不禁食呢？」

words.note: Lit. 'gate follower'.
Lit. 'forbid eating'.
Lit. 'gate follower'.
Lit. 'forbid eating'.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「新郎跟賓客在一起的時候，賓客怎能哀痛呢？但到了時候，新郎就要從他們中間被取去，那時他們就要禁食了。

words.note: Lit. 'new gentleman'.
Lit. 'new gentleman'.
Implies removal, often by force or destiny.
Lit. 'forbid eating'.

verses.text: 沒有人會拿一塊新布補在舊衣服上，因為補上的會把衣服扯破，裂的地方就更大了。
也沒有人會把新酒裝在舊皮袋裡，如果這樣，皮袋就會脹破，酒就漏出來，皮袋也損壞了。人總是把新酒裝在新皮袋裡，這樣，兩樣都可以保全。」

words.note: Refers to a container made from animal skin for wine.

verses.text: 治好血漏病的女人耶穌對他們說話的時候，有一位會堂的主管走來跪在他面前，說：「我的女兒剛死了，但請你來按手在她身上，她必活過來。」

words.note: Refers to chronic abnormal bleeding, often found in Gospel narratives.
Verb-object compound: 'speak words'.
Refers to Jewish place of worship and assembly.
A gesture in religious ceremonies, often for healing or blessing.

verses.text: 於是耶穌和門徒起來跟著他去了。

words.note: Refers to followers or students, especially of Jesus.

verses.text: 有一個女人，患了十二年的血漏病，她走到耶穌背後，摸他衣服的繸子，

words.note: Refers to chronic abnormal bleeding, often found in Gospel narratives.
Refers to the ritual fringes (tzitzit) worn by Jews on garments.

verses.text: 因為她心裡說：「只要摸到他的衣服，我就必痊愈。」

words.note: Verb-complement structure.
Stronger than 會 (will).

verses.text: 耶穌轉過來看見她，就說：「女兒，放心！你的信心使你痊愈了。」從那時起，那女人就好了。

words.note: Verb-complement indicating turning towards the speaker/subject.
Verb-complement indicating successful seeing.
Lit. 'release heart'.
Crucial theological term.
Often used with 從 (cóng) to indicate duration or starting point.

verses.text: 使女孩復活耶穌進了那主管的家，看見有吹笛的人和喧嘩的群眾，

words.note: Verb + perfective particle 'le'.
Verb-complement indicating successful seeing.
Verb-object compound.
Here forming a noun phrase, 'the ones who play flute'.

verses.text: 就說：「出去！這女孩不是死了，只是睡了。」他們就嘲笑他。

words.note: Verb-complement indicating movement away from speaker.

verses.text: 耶穌趕走眾人之後，進去拉著女孩的手，女孩就起來了。

words.note: Verb-complement indicating driving something away.
Verb-complement indicating movement into a place away from the speaker.
Verb + durative aspect particle 'zhe'.
Verb-complement indicating upward movement or commencement.

verses.text: 這消息傳遍了那一帶。

words.note: Indicates completed action or change of state.

verses.text: 治好瞎子耶穌離開那裡的時候，有兩個瞎子跟著他，喊著說：「大衛的子孫，可憐我們吧！」

words.note: Connects a modifying clause to a noun.
Used before measure words, unlike '二 (èr)'.
Commonly refers to 'son of David' in the Bible, a messianic title.

verses.text: 耶穌進了房子，他們來到他那裡。耶穌問他們：「你們信我能作這些事嗎？」他們回答：「主啊，我們信。」

words.note: A respectful title, often referring to God or Jesus.
Expresses exclamation or serves as a filler word.

verses.text: 於是耶穌摸他們的眼睛，說：「照你們的信心給你們成就吧。」

words.note: A core concept in Christianity, meaning trust and belief.

verses.text: 他們的眼睛就看見了。耶穌嚴嚴地囑咐他們：「千萬不可讓人知道。」

words.note: Indicates a consequence or immediate succession.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Reduplication of adjective for emphasis, plus adverbial particle.

words.definition: by all means, absolutely must not
words.note: Literally 'thousand ten thousand', means 'absolutely' or 'by no means'.

verses.text: 他們卻出去，把他所作的事傳遍了那一帶。
治好啞巴他們出去的時候，有人帶著一個被鬼附著的啞巴來見耶穌。

words.note: Part of a heading or summary.
Part of a heading or summary.
Functions as a temporal conjunction.

verses.text: 耶穌把鬼趕走之後，啞巴就說話了。眾人都很驚奇，說：「這樣的事，在以色列從來沒有見過。」
但法利賽人說：「他不過是靠鬼王趕鬼罷了。」
莊稼多，工人少耶穌走遍各城各鄉，在各會堂裡教導人，宣揚天國的福音，醫治各種疾病、各種病症。

words.note: Part of a heading or summary.
An idiomatic phrase referring to all places.

verses.text: 他看見群眾，就憐憫他們，因為他們困苦無依，像沒有牧人的羊一樣。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for divine compassion.
Literally 'without reliance'.
Strong biblical imagery; refers to a spiritual leader.

verses.text: 他就對門徒說：「莊稼多，工人少；

words.note: Refers to followers of a teacher, specifically Jesus' disciples.
Often used metaphorically for souls ready for salvation.

verses.text: 所以你們應當求莊稼的主派工人去收割他的莊稼。」

words.note: Used metaphorically for souls ready for salvation.
In this context, referring to God.
Often implies gathering people for spiritual purposes.
Used metaphorically for souls ready for salvation.
